etymologies: Middle English: turtle from Old English turtla, turtle ‘turtle dove’ (from Latin turtur, of imitative origin)

definitions: a small Old World dove with a soft purring call, noted for the apparent affection shown for its mate.

notes.text: Genus Streptopelia, family Columbidae: several species, in particular the migratory European and North African S. turtur, with a reddish-brown back and pinkish breast

shortDefinitions: small Old World dove with soft purring call
